article: I woke up the other day to find that 10 inches of freshly fallen snow was waiting for me outside my door. The flakes were still _ heavily too. I didn't want my little dogs _ in it, so I reluctantly _ on my heavy coat and grabbed the snow shovel to make a _ . I had only gotten a bit done, however, _ the handle of my old snow shovel _ with a "snap". Laughing and shaking my head, I _ to wait out the storm for a while. It was late in the afternoon when the snow finally _ and I trudged over to my Dad's house to borrow his shovel and _ again. By then the 10 inches of snow had turned into a foot and a half. I started out slow setting a steady _ and stopping to rest whenever my back started to ache. After a while, though, the _ finally broke and the sun peeked out to _ me on. The work seemed a lot easier then even though it was still _ . I even sang a few Christmas carols and _ while I cleared out the drives, cleaned off the cars, and shoveled out the paths. After an hour of hard work the job was finally done. _ , I let the child that still lives _ of me fall back into the snow and _ a snow angel for the angels in Heaven to see. It felt good walking back to my house after a job well done. It felt even better _ around at this wonderful world of white. I don't know why life sometimes gives us spring days and sometimes dumps a ton of snow in us. I do know, _ , that we can pray, laugh, love, and choose _ through it all.
